description.narrative:
The Karnataka State Highway Improvement Project will upgrade about 615 kilometers (km) of state highways in the state of Karnataka and strengthen the capacity of the Public Works Department (PWD) of the Government of Karnataka (GOK) to develop, operate, and maintain the state road network.
The project includes consulting services for implementation of civil works and support the establishment and operation of the Planning and Road Asset Management Centre (PRAMC) of the PWD.
Associated TA will be provided to support and strengthen the PWD's capacity in asset management, road safety, and private sector participation. Road improvement works will include the upgrading of existing roads to two lanes; green-field construction of bypasses; strengthening of culverts and bridges; and constructing new bridges, rail overbridges, and cross-draining structures.

participating-org.narrative: Public Works Department, Government of Karnataka

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: More efficient and sustainable transport operations on the state highway network.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
By 2015 (the end of the project): Average travel time on the project roads reduced by 25% (baseline year 2009)

description.narrative: More efficient and sustainable transport operations on the state highway network.

title.narrative: Frequency of fatal and severe injury accidents on project roads reduced by 20% (baseline year 2009)

description.narrative: More efficient and sustainable transport operations on the state highway network.

title.narrative: International roughness index on project roads reduced to at least 3.5 meters per kilometer (baseline year 2009)

description.narrative: More efficient and sustainable transport operations on the state highway network.
